title: US man linked to Wieambilla shooters sentenced to three years in prison
summary_full: Donald Day discussed extreme conspiracies with Queensland family before they killed two police officers and a neighbour at rural propertyFollow our Australia news live blog for latest updatesGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastAn American man who spent a year discussing extreme conspiracies with the Queensland family behind the Wieambilla shootings has been sentenced to three years’ imprisonment.Donald Day, 58, was arrested in the US after a year-long investigation into his contact with Gareth, Nathaniel and Stacey Train before the trio killed two police officers and a neighbour at their rural Queensland property. Continue reading...
